data.title: Countdown of Man Utd Top 25 Champions League group stage goals
data.meta_description: Will you agree with the order of our list? Take a look and see, as we prepare for a 25 season at this stage of the competition.
data.text:
And, yes, you guessed it, there are 25 of them in our list.

A LEGENDARY COUNTDOWN

United and the European Cup go hand in hand, dating all the way back to that historic 1956/57 season under Sir Matt Busby.

But our countdown here focuses specifically on the rebranded Champions League years and from the club's first involvement, back in 1994/95.

Barring the odd blemish, our record in the group stage has been exemplary and there have been some truly magnificent goals scored along the way.

But which have made it into our top 25? Scroll down to see which strikes are included in the first part of our list, from 25 to 11.

#5: Andy Cole v Marseille (h), 1999/00

#4: Ryan Giggs (2nd) v Juventus (a), 2002/03

#3: Ruud van Nistelrooy (2nd) v Basel (a), 2002/03

#2: Andy Cole v Barcelona (a), 1998/99

#1: Paul Scholes (2nd) v Panathinaikos (h), 2000/01

FOLLOW THE GROUP-STAGE DRAW

After three years away, the draw for the 2023/24 Champions League will take place at Grimaldi Forum in Monaco, from 17:00 BST on Thursday, revealing which three sides we will face.

One of Europeâ€™s elite is coming, with Barcelona, Bayern Munich, Benfica, Feyenoord, Napoli, Paris Saint-Germain and Sevilla our possible Pot One opponents.

United will be in Pot Two, and Pots Three and Four were confirmed on Wednesday evening when the third-round play-offs were concluded. Let us know who you want via the three polls below.

You can follow live coverage and reaction via the United App.
